meanings.definition: To remove a hood from something.
meanings.sent1: He carefully unhooded the statue to reveal its true beauty.
meanings.sent2: The magician unhooded the bird, surprising the audience with its colors.
meanings.sent3: The chef unhooded the pot, releasing a delicious aroma into the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: She unhooded the lantern, casting light into the dark room.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic unhooded the engine, revealing the intricate machinery inside.
